org.gradoop.flink.io.api.metadata

Interface MetaDataSink<M extends MetaData>

  • Type Parameters:
    M - a meta data type
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CSVMetaDataSink

    public interface MetaDataSink<M extends MetaData>
    Class defining a sink for meta data. Meta data can be written locally or distributed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void writeDistributed(String path, org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<org.apache.flink.api.java.tuple.Tuple3<String,String,String>> metaDataTuples, org.apache.flink.core.fs.FileSystem.WriteMode writeMode)
      Write the meta data tuples to the specified file.
      void writeLocal(String path, M metaData, org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration hdfsConfig, boolean overwrite)
      Write the meta data to a the specified file.

    • Method Detail

      • writeDistributed

        void writeDistributed(String path,
                      org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<org.apache.flink.api.java.tuple.Tuple3<String,String,String>> metaDataTuples,
                      org.apache.flink.core.fs.FileSystem.WriteMode writeMode)
        Write the meta data tuples to the specified file. The tuples have the form (element prefix, label, metadata).
        Parameters:
        path - path to the meta data file
        metaDataTuples - (element prefix (g,v,e), label, meta data) tuples
        writeMode - write mode, overwrite or not

      • writeLocal

        void writeLocal(String path,
                M metaData,
                org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration hdfsConfig,
                boolean overwrite)
         throws IOException
        Write the meta data to a the specified file. The file can be either located in a local file system or in HDFS.
        Parameters:
        path - path to the meta data file
        metaData - meta data object
        hdfsConfig - hdfs file configuration
        overwrite - write mode, overwrite or not
        Throws:
        IOException - on error when writing file locally
